title: Vanessa Feltz nearly DIED after gastric band implanted into her liver
text:
Vanessa Feltz has candidly revealed that her family feared she had died while undergoing an operation earlier this year.

The TV personality, 57, told how surgeons discovered that her gastric band had embedded itself in her liver during gastric bypass surgery in January.

During an interview with Best magazine, Vanessa admitted that her family worried they had lost her after the 45 minute operation took more than five hours.

Scary: Vanessa Feltz has candidly revealed that her family feared she had died while undergoing an operation earlier this year

Detailing her horrific weight loss journey, Vanessa told the publication: 'It was pretty much hell before I had my gastric bypass in January.

'The gastric band I had fitted in 2010 would have been alright for some, but for me it was brutal. Your food can get stuck in the band - and you puke it up. It's very unpredictable.'

In order to fix the issue, Vanessa went under the knife earlier this year however she suffered complications when the doctors discovered the implanted band.

Shocking: The TV personality, 57, told how surgeons discovered that her gastric band had embedded itself in her liver during gastric bypass surgery in January (Vanessa pictured in 2006)

She added: 'I went down to theatre at 8.30am. They said it would take 45 minutes, but at 1.30pm, I was still there. I was told after that my family were terrified they'd lost me.'

Vanessa revealed in August that her three-and-a-half stone weight loss has made her more confident and helped her sex life - despite her fiancé of 13 years Ben Ofoedu, 46, not having any complaints to begin with.

The TV star explained that she feels more confident and enjoys wearing sexy lingerie in the bedroom now that she has shed the pounds down to a size 12.

Fears: During an interview with Best magazine, Vanessa admitted that her family worried they had lost her after the 45 minute operation took more than five hours

Horrific: Detailing her horrific weight loss journey, Vanessa told the publication: 'It was pretty much hell before I had my gastric bypass in January' (pictured in 2006)

'I've been able to get sexier underwear. I love a négligée - I've got some fabulous satin ones which I think are absolutely irresistible to Ben,' she told Woman Magazine.

She went on: 'He doesn't seem to have become any less keen on a bit of how's your father, put it that way. He likes a bigger woman with a big fat bum.

'Mine has almost dwindled away, so I don't think he'd have cared if I hadn't lost an ounce, but he likes the confidence.'

She also wants to loose a further half stone by the end of 2019 - insisting that it's not just about the way she looks, it's also about health.

In March, Vanessa revealed on This Morning that she had a gastric bypass in January, during surgery to have her gastric band removed, and confirmed that she has lost the weight in under three months.

Vanessa's gastric band was fitted in 2010, and she famously admitted she used to try and 'cheat' the weight-loss procedure by drinking 'chocolate custard'
description: Vanessa Feltz has candidly revealed that her family feared she had died while undergoing an operation earlier this year.
